Stayed a few nights
review_text: I had wanted to try Getaway Brown County for a year now and was pleased to find listings on AirBNB, a platform I'm familiar with. There was a little lag in communication before checking in, but once I got there, I was very pleased with everything. They really thought of including everything for you - I had packed some seemingly extra items (lighters, a flashlight, first aid kit) and they already had those. It truly was grown-up camping, without needing to set up a tent or share a bathroom/showers with strangers! The roads to the site are gravel, so drive carefully. You're only 20 minutes or so away from Brown County State Park, my husband I spent an afternoon hiking, and the next day enjoying the sounds of the rain from within our cozy cabin. We will definitely be back!

May 2024
,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: 5 stars for the Getaway house. 1 star for non-responsive hosts. The Getaway house was perfect, just as shown in photos. Very clean, cozy, beautiful surroundings. Recommend it to anyone wanting a restful and relaxing couple days off the grid. The problem was the hosts donâ€™t respond. We arrived 20min early (240p) for a 3pm check-in. We notified the hosts and asked if we could go into the house a few minutes early (there was no one staying in or cleaning the house). No response. We messaged through the app and texted the phone number listed. No response. We called the number listed. No response. Finally at 305p (5min after check in) we called the main AirBnB line, who tried to contact the hosts. Finally at 330p - 30min after check in - we received two different codes to access the house, which was confusing. Bottom line - definitely stay in the house because itâ€™s awesome but donâ€™t expect the hosts to help you.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: My significant other and I originally had plans for a different cabin however the cabin we reserved was just not what we were wanting. We found Getaways listing and made a last minute reservation. Getaway was very accommodating and quickly confirmed our reservation. This little camper was pretty perfect for a cozy weekend in nature. Our dogs loved the area and we had plenty of trails and walks to try out. We enjoyed all the amenities it had to offer! The beds do get really hot at night so we had to make sure we set the air on the right temp but other than that, we had a great stay. Our pups even got a special treat. Lastly there were other campers within our view however everyone was very respectful and kept to themselves!

The only mild complaint we had is that the overhead photo on the listing shows longer driveways to the cabins and more privacy than in reality. If you step outside the cabin there is no privacy meaning no privacy at the fire pit. We could see at least 4 other cabins and their occupants when outside. From our big window we could see another cabin and their fire pit and vehicle and could see them turning on and off lights in their cabin at night (we did visit in a winter month so if the trees were full there would likely be less visibility). This did not affect our enjoyment much and we would definitely visit again but we were a little surprised when we arrived because of the pictures in the listing.

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
My husband and I came here for our 1 year anniversary and it was PERFECT. We love hiking and being in a private setting, and this was perfect. We brought our Golden Retriever, and Getaway was so accommodating. They left little dog bowls and doggie bags, which was so thoughtful. We walked the nature path at the back of the property and we loved it! We also hit some trails and shops in Brown County and it was a short 20 minute drive to downtown Nashville.
We even struggled with some snow, getting out of the drive, and their staff was already onsite and came up to offer us traction mats. They were around and available, but not too much in our space.
10/10 would recommend for a private, serene setting.

review_text:
This location is very beautiful and peaceful. Clean, modern, and well built.
There was some strange confusion though about provisions (fire wood, coffee, s'mores, etc) inside and at the location. The listing says some things are included, like fire wood and s'mores for example, but when you enter the cabin you will find a list of items that will cost extra. Fire wood and s'mores are on this list. (Unless this is changed by the time you are reading this. which hopefully it is.) That said, I haven't gotten a bill for the items I used, and when I messaged the host they didn't answer my question about if they were included or not. Hopefully this confusion is cleared up before your stay.

name: Jessie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
Â·
December 2023
,
Â·
Stayed one night
review_text: I absolutely LOVED staying here with Getaway. In fact, I loved it so much that I actually booked another night. The team was super responsive and helpful in getting me another night and reimbursing me so I wasn't paying a cleaning fee twice. This tiny house looked EXACTLY like the pictures and the woods were even more stunning in person. They even have a private walking trail, which is nice (though it's made of chunky rocks, not gravel, so bring good shoes). The amenities were great. The only downsides were that they mean it when they say there is a small hot water tank. I only had hot water for about 5 minutes both times I took a shower. The only other thing to warn about (which this is in no way Getaway's fault) is that the property is surrounded by a bunch of private property where people hunt, so you will hear occasional gunshots. Overall however, I had an amazing time and this place was the exact amount of peaceful and loveliness that I needed. Thank you, Getaway.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We went to Seymour for the eclipse. The town had bands and food trucks on Sunday and that was fun. Coffee, tea and scones across the street at Moxie were yummy, and we loved Taqueria La Mejor for Mexican food, and also great bar service at rails. The place is exactly as pictured, and we liked walking to everything. We did wish there was a screen door to let in some fresh air. If you're a light sleeper, bring some earplugs as the trains pass close by at night. La Michoacana for ice cream is also close by, with some fun flavors you'll not find at a DQ. The people of Seymour did a great job hosting!

review_text: I have been traveling to Seymour for a year for my job. For part of the year I shared it with another traveler. It has a large bathroom with 2 sinks which was great. It has 2 beds, one a bit more firm while the other is softer, but both great. I really appreciated the full kitchen, a girl can only Door Dash so much so it was great to be able to make food. It was very well supplied with anything you could need. Shawn as a host is great! Communicates very quickly and stays on top of getting you clean towels and sheets. review_text:
Such an unique experience! The place was charming and adorable! Everything was clean. The water pressure/heat was good, plenty of space throughout for three women getting ready for a conference. The beds were a nice surprise. Queen memory foam/therapeutic feel. The beds are med firm with soft feel on top, but no sinking whatsoever. â¤ï¸ Snacks, coffee and water available. Bathroom amenities if needed. The temp was set just right, no adjustment needed and usually one of us is cold while the other is more hot-natured.
The windows in the place allow for natural light in the morning. I am one who likes the room pitch black, and forgot to bring my sleeping mask :/ However, the sunrise and the natural light made everything feel cozy, bright and happy. :) I donâ€™t get to see it often, so it didnâ€™t bother me for one night.
We would love to stay again next year during our conference if there is availability. Host was fast in responding and available for anything we needed or questions we had. Area was safe, and quiet. Plus there is a diner across the street that smelled wonderful when you were outside :)
Def a 5-star experience!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
This Airbnb was absolutely fabulous: Clean, Easy Check-In, Plenty of room, etc. It has a nice large bathroom with double sinks, comfy beds, great kitchen, etc. Close to everything such as good shopping and restaurants.
A long-time friend and I took a Road Trip to see the Mellencamp mural. There is so much more to see and do in town! We took the Mellencamp driving tour. You may purchase a CD at the Visitor's Center, but check the hours before you go. We made it to town and they were to close in the next ten minutes. The young lady on duty waited for us and was so helpful!!!
We visited the music store next to the mural, purchased t-shirts and visited with the owner for quite some time. Everyone we met in Seymour was so helpful and nice!
We ate @ Vat & Barrel, a local brewery, where both owners visited with us and made us feel so welcome. We had an early brunch @ Larrison's Diner and the food was spot-on. If you like pizza, Seymour Brewing/Pizza Co. was excellent and we highly recommend for a late lunch or dinner.
We highly recommend this property and a visit to Seymour, IN! We had such a great stay!!

review_text: Melinda's place was beautiful and exactly what we expected for the location. It was located very close to the town of Versailles and the State Park, which was perfect for us. The beds were comfy and the kitchen was fully stocked. Unfortunately, there was a dog who was kept in a pen right beside the Airbnb that barked almost constantly. At first, we didn't mind, but then the barking seemed to get worse, and it really put a dent in our peaceful weekend. Our own dog seemed stressed about it and was anxious to leave the property. While the cabin was lovely, and in a good spot for us, we wouldn't choose to stay again.

This is a quaint and comfortable stay. The town of our Versailles is nearby and is beautiful with cute places to stop on the Square. Madison is nearby and is a gorgeous town on the Ohio river.
My single complaint is that the Wi-Fi was down and I was not aware of that prior to coming. I had to use a hotspot to connect to the Internet to work. Unfortunately, cell service is not strong and so I could not maintain web conference calls in the Airbnb and ended up having to sit in my car at the Square where I had better service. It would have been helpful to know of this issue prior to the stay. I brought my puppy with me and did not bring his travel crate, as I was not expecting to be away from him, but did end up having to leave him to do a couple of work calls downtown.

The house has everything you need, and the hosts left hand soap, shampoo, conditioner and body soap in both bathroomsâ€”which rarely do we find in other rentals homes. They also had a first aid kit with band aids (which we needed to use). Also, the kitchen is well equipped to include spices and condiments. We ordered Walmart grocery delivery and had a BBQ one night and then cooked a Sunday brunch. They even had an indoor griddle that we used for pancakes! The most important part of the amenities was the basket of toddler toys that was a game changer for our 2 year old granddaughter. Plus books and games that all of us played every day and eveningâ€”unplugged family time! We also used the outdoor fire place which is beautiful. Hands down, the BEST rental weâ€™ve had thru Airbnb! Thank you!

Michaelâ€™s place was absolutely home away from home!! Our party consisted of 6 adults and a 4 year old. There was something for everyone. My husband enjoyed using the grill (and we enjoyed that he did too). The master bath was lovely. The open kitchen-dining-living area allowed us to share conversation easily. All of the beds provided a great nightâ€™s sleep. The upstairs bonus room was our granddaughterâ€™s favorite place to be! She expended much time and energy going up and down the stairs and was delighted to do so!!
The many things that you take for granted at home were there, which also made it especially comfy and welcoming. There were plenty of linens and pillows. We used the sewing kit and the hot water bottle. The crock pot was a welcome sight. There was also that one drawer in the kitchen with a tape measure, matches, scissors, pencil sharpener and other odds and ends. (We used that too!!)
We will definitely look for Michaelâ€™s place in the future!!

review_text: Micheal's place was nothing short of amazing. We loved making cappuccino/latte coffees every morning and enjoying each other's company in the large, open kitchen/living area space. The beds were SO comfortable. The communication with Michael and his daughter (who helps manage the home) was easy and helpful. This place made us feel right at home. I've described it as feeling like you're staying at your aunt and uncle's house and they're just out of town. We truly felt right at home and peaceful for a few days. I absolutely recommend this place, and will be back if/when I need to stay near Columbus again. It was also 8-12 minutes to anything you could want and need - perfect location. It was also extremely clean; this was the happiest I've been with cleanliness in any airBNB I've ever stayed. 100% recommend -- thank you, Micheal + family!

Johnathan and Renae went ABOVE and BEYOND to make our stay a great one! I have never left a review as good as the one you are about to see here!
They brought in some TV trays for us since I was concerned that the kitchen table wouldn't be large enough for an elaborate game (it was). I had asked if we needed to pick up creamer before arrival since many places provide the powdered stuff. They got us two types of CoffeMate creamer, a fresh bottle of 2% milk, orange juice and even FRESH apple fritters for the morning!
We were thrilled ğŸ˜„!
The refrigerator was full of yogurts, fresh fruits, assorted canned drinks, and a little alcohol. The array of breakfast and snacks provided was impressive.
The bathroom had extra toothbrushes and toothpaste, soaps, shampoos, wet wipes...pretty much anything you might need.
Being a shutterbug, I decided to take a bunch of photos for them to add to their listing if they want.
We will definitely stay again!

the use if the 2 garage is a big bonus since I could store 4 bicycles and truck inside.
the neighborhood is very quiet and neighbors are respectful.
this is my only choice to stay in this area!
Shopping:
The local meat market Reihls and deli had great ground chuck 80/20 and reasonable price.
Restaurants:
Highly recommend: 1.Crossroads in Versailles and get the tenderloin sandwich. Tenderloin breaded and as big as your head!
2. Wagners in Oldenberg IN. Fried chicken at its best! Fried in cast iron skillets and served family style. Don't expect quick meal as it takes time to get chicken like your grandmother used to make!

review_text:
Beautiful historic building and we will book again when we return to Seymour. A few great surprises like the hidden prize (no, I won't give you any clues). I wish that their coffee shop downstairs was in my neighborhood- I would be there every day. I only share the below cautions to prepare you and I encourage you not to let them turn you off. Great place and great people.
A few cautions.
1) Steep stairs, though even my stair-phobic wife made it with no problem.
2) Noisy trains overnight. I find the train noise soothing, but grew up with it. My family members who are less used to it found it bothersome.
3) Heat needs to be up a bit higher to get into the bedrooms. Leave the doors open for the best circulation.

We are from Massachusetts. When we journey to the Midwest we are always charmed by the historic small towns and the friendliness of the residents. Seymour, Indiana is no exception.
Monticaâ€™s Air BandB is somewhat of a time travelâ€¦a late 1800s building, floors and windows that resonate with that era. Stand at the front windows and blur your vision a bit. Just like a movie that floats back in time, you will be transported as you imagine the turn of the century here. Sit in the living area and you are mid century modern. Prepare a meal in the kitchen, you are squarely in 2023.
This was the most spacious two bedroom we have seen in our travels. We will return and always feel at home.
Dint miss this opportunity if you are passing through.

,
Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Airbnb above a coffee shop in downtown Seymour (the town where John Mellencamp is from). Parking is at the rear of the building in the back of a little square park between buildings. The little park has flowers and squirrels. You enter directly into the unit, but take a floor of steps to get to the second floor of the building where the rooms are. Note you do have to be able to walk up steps. Not a problem for us, but might be for some people. You then enter a long hallway that leads to the living room/kitchen. Along the hallway are the bathroom (there is only one), a small laundry area with a washer and dryer, and two bedrooms. In the bathroom is a walk in shower with great water pressure. We all absolutely loved the shower. Both bedrooms had beds with foam mattresses. The kitchen is a full kitchen with microwave, refrigerator/freezer, stove, oven, dishwasher. There is a bootlegger hidden panel in the floor of the kitchen/living room where you might find some liquor.

Â·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: So clean, so convenient, so thoughtfully appointed! This was an A+ experience. Many rental spaces fail to strike the right balance between being well stocked with amenities and pleasing decorations and having sufficient space for the renters' "stuff." A kitchen shouldn't be so crammed with cooking/serving gear that there is no space for a renter's groceries, but neither should the cupboards and fridge be bare of helpful supplies. Jennifer's place was frankly perfect. It was cute, comfortable, and accommodating, offering thoughtful supplies and comforts but still leaving plenty of space to enable us to settle in and feel at home. The lighting was good, the beds and bedding comfy, the electric outlets convenient, the window treatments offering good privacy, and the overall feeling very safe and secure. Big thumbs up! Thank you, Jennifer!

review_text: Jennifer's place in Columbus is a small freestanding house with the important 3Cs - it's comfortable, cozy, and super clean. We slept well on the great mattresses. There are loads of towels and hot water and bedding, the kitchen basics you need, a washer and drier, a little dining nook, and off-street parking in this safe residential neighborhood. Some special touches: TVs in each of the bedrooms, in addition to the big living room TV, and a collection of board games if you prefer not to watch TV. The front porch features a nice porch swing! The street traffic outside is a bit busy at evening rush hour but the rest of the time is light and unobstrusive. We are very glad we stayed in this relaxing home and we recommend it highly.

review_text: Annette was very friendly and easy to communicate, even in the weeks leading up to our stay. Once we were checked in, she was very easily reachable about any questions we had regarding the cabin or the area. There were even more furnishings and amenities than we realized once we got settled in. The cabin is beautiful down to every small detail and all of the windows as well as the setback into the woods give it a really isolated and relaxing feel to the environment. You feel as though you have the entire area to yourself. The creek directly behind the cabin is such a tranquil addition to the relaxation. Drinking coffee early in the morning on the beautiful balcony while listening to the water flow is an unrivaled experience. We stayed at Annetteâ€™s cabin while visiting family, and we will most definitely be looking to reserve it again on our next visit.
